title: Bug 37021 - Source path displayed incorrectly in declare warning on binary files
description: When running tests on binary files using the command 'tests/new/binaryWarnings/..', the source path is displayed incorrectly in the declare warning messages for [java|aj] files. The problem can be observed when filename checking is not enabled during harness verification of messages. In AJDT, if the filename does not make sense, it is simply omitted.
OB: The current declare warning messages for .class files from injars display the source path in the format 'app.Main.class'.
EB: The expected behavior is to display the source path in the format 'app/Main'.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Run the command 'tests/new/binaryWarnings/..'
2. Observe the declare warning messages for [java|aj] files targeting .class files from injars.
3. Note that the source path is displayed incorrectly in the 'app.Main.class' format instead of 'app/Main'.
